newsitem.title: USA: K2 sticking to takeover trail.
newsitem.headline: K2 sticking to takeover trail.

text.p: ORLANDO, Jan 24, Reuter - High-end sporting-goods maker K2 Inc remains on the acquisition trail and is eagerly looking for properties outside its mainstay businesses, K2 senior vice president John Rangel said on Friday.
"Where we can get the greatest benefit is with acquisitions that gives us entre into new categories," Rangel said at a sporting-goods industry conference he sponsored by AG Edwards Inc.
Rangel gave no details on any deals.

A leader manufacturer of in-line skates, K2 also makes technically advanced and expensive skis and snowboards, as well as fishing equipment, camping gear, bicycles, life vests and sportswear. Its brands include Shakespeare fishing poles, K2 skates and Olin skis.
The Los Angeles-based company bought in 1995 backpack-maker Dana Design, whose products sell for $250 or more, and acquired the mountain-bike maker Girvin in 1993.
"It is an integral part of our strategy going forward," Rangel said when asked about another acquisition.
